reviews.content: I wanted to thank Nick Machupa PT. I had a shoulder impingement for over a year and Nick not only relieved the impingement but he educated me on the hows and whys. I also wanted to thank Sherry, who checked me out. She took the time to assist me with rescheduling my next appointment. Everyone I saw on staff seems super excited and loving their job.

I have been going here for years but in the last year or so, the service has really gone downhill.  I regularly have to wait an HOUR to see my doctor for review of labs.  The last time I was in for a 9 am appointment, a lady who worked there was walking around the waiting room to see what time our appointments were etc. - at the time I'd been waiting 20 minutes and she told me that even though my appointment was for 9, my doctor doesn't usually get there until 9:30 or so!!!!!!  This day, I waited until 9:40 to be called back and another 10 minutes before my doctor showed up. To catch you up:  I left work at 8:50 for my 9:00 am appointment and waited until 9:50 to be seen by my doctor then traveled another 10 minutes back to work:  I was gone over an hour, which I considered my lunch break.  I've stayed so long because of the onsite labs, MRI, ultrasounds etc. but to see my actual doctor - I've had enough.

I have been going here for a long time, like 10 years, and I don't see any reason to ever look for another doctor office. The place has everything you need, like an onsite blood test lab and X-rays and MRI. I really don't ever have to go anywhere else when I have a problem. The staff is really nice also.

If you like to wait, can time 1/2 day off from work, or are retired and have nothing to do, well this is the place for you! After 45 minute wait past my appointment time, it was going to be another 15 minutes. I took time off from work and enough was enough. Walked out, never saw Dr Alpers, staff is all smiles telling you to have a nice day when they can clearly see I was pissed off.
